title: How are different versions of the same songs and videos available on YouTube? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you own a YouTube channel and upload your “Original” videos, then you won’t face any copyright issue since it is your own content/material. But uploading other’s videos (songs, documentary, tutorials or anything), which are copyrighted by the respective YouTuber or a Company, is an infringement of copyright and so the video will eventually get blocked or deleted.
